title: Syrian electors vote in indirect polls for first post-Assad parliament
summary: Two-thirds of Syria's new parliament will be chosen by electoral colleges, with the rest appointed by interim president.

title: Nairobi’s ‘Birdman’: Rescuing raptors on the streets of Kenya’s capital
summary: Rodgers Oloo Magutha, who’s lived much of his life on the streets, has big dreams of one day opening a bird shelter.

title: Al-Shabab fighters killed in Mogadishu prison assault, Somalia confirms
summary: Attackers wore military uniform and rode vehicles imitating security forces to breach a high-security prison in capital.

title: Week in Pictures: Pro-Gaza protests in Europe to floods in Sudan
summary: A global roundup of some of last week’s events.

title: LIVE: India vs Pakistan – ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025
summary: Follow our live build-up, news, scores, weather updates and commentary stream for the match in Colombo at 09:30 GMT.

title: India probes possible cough syrup link to deaths of at least nine children
summary: Three states ban the cough syrup after children die allegedly after consuming the product.

title: UFC 320: Pereira stuns Ankalaev with TKO to regain light heavyweight title
summary: Alex Pereira won back the light heavyweight title with a technical knockout of Magomed Ankalaev at UFC 320 in Las Vegas.

title: LIVE: Israel targets Gaza’s ‘safe zones’ as Egypt hosts negotiations
summary: Talks aim at ending nearly two years of war, with Israel's leader expressing hope that captives would be released.

title: Poland deploys air defences as Russia launches new strikes on Ukraine
summary: Warsaw says ground-based air defence, radar reconnaissance systems also brought to the 'highest state of readiness'.

title: Lionel Messi assists Inter Miami back into win column against Revolution
summary: A trio of assists by star forward Lionel Messi helped Inter Miami crush New England Revolution in Major League Soccer.

title: Real Madrid beat Villarreal as Vinicius Jr scores two goals, Mbappe injured
summary: A Vinicius Jr brace helped Madrid reclaim top spot in La Liga after Kylian Mbappe limped off with an ankle sprain.

title: North Korea’s Kim vows additional military measures ahead of major parade
summary: Kim Jong Un says Pyongyang will counter the buildup of US forces in the Korean Peninsula.

title: Plan de paix pour Gaza : la priorité pour Netanyahu reste la libération des otages
summary: Le Premier ministre israélien Benjamin Netanyahu estime les deux objectifs que sont la libération des otages et le démantèlement militaire du Hamas dans la bande de Gaza sont en passe d'être atteints. Selon le chef du gouvernement israélien, c'est bel et bien la pression militaire exercée depuis deux ans contre le Hamas dans la bande de Gaza qui a fait plier le mouvement islamiste et l'a conduit à accepter les conditions posées par Donald Trump. Les précisions de notre correspondant à Jérusalem, Stéphane Amar.

title: En direct - Plan pour Gaza : négociations attendues au Caire, manifestations en soutien aux Palestiniens en Europe
summary: Des négociateurs israéliens et du Hamas sont attendus dimanche au Caire pour des discussions indirectes sur le plan Trump, qui ambitionne de mettre fin à la guerre à Gaza et de parvenir à la libération des otages. Le président américain a prévenu qu'il ne "tolérerait aucun retard" dans l'application du plan, et a assuré qu'Israël avait accepté une première "ligne de retrait". A Rome, Barcelone, et Madrid des foules se sont rassemblées en soutien aux Palestiniens samedi. Suivez notre direct.

title: La Syrie organise ses premières élections législatives post-Assad, le processus contesté
summary: La Syrie se dote dimanche de son premier Parlement de l'ère post-Assad dans un processus critiqué pour son manque de démocratie, le tiers des membres étant nommé par le président intérimaire Ahmad al-Chareh.

title: Plan pour Gaza : Israël et le Hamas attendus lundi au Caire pour des négociations indirectes
summary: Le Premier ministre israélien Benjamin Netanyahu a déclaré samedi espérer la libération de tous les otages retenus à Gaza "dans les prochains jours", alors que des délégations israélienne et du Hamas doivent se rendre au Caire lundi pour des négociations sous médiation égyptienne. Malgré l’appel de Donald Trump à cesser les bombardements, l’armée israélienne poursuit ses opérations dans l’enclave palestinienne.

title: Hakim Khaldi : "La première urgence, c'est de réunifier le pays"
summary: Après 50 ans de dictature, la Syrie organise ses premières élections législatives libres sur le papier, même si le nouvel homme fort du pays, l'ancien chef des rebelles du groupe Hayat Tahrir al-Cham Ahmed al-Charaa, garde largement la main sur le processus électoral. Dans un discours remarqué à la tribune de l'Assemblée générale de l'ONU la semaine dernière, il a promis de réunifier la Syrie et de juger les personnes responsables d'exactions à l'encontre des minorités. Des règlements de compte de l'ère post-Assad qui ont suscité beaucoup d'interrogations sur les intentions du nouveau pouvoir et sa capacité à ramener la sécurité dans le pays. Hakim Khaldi, humanitaire chez Médecins Sans Frontières et auteur de l'ouvrage "Dans la Syrie post-Assad : Carnets de bord" (éd. L'Harmattan), était l'invité d'"Au cœur de l’info".

title: Plan Trump : encore de nombreuses zones d'ombre
summary: Vendredi, le Hamas s'est dit prêt à des négociations immédiates en vue de la libération des otages israéliens et de la fin de la guerre qui ravage depuis près de deux ans la bande de Gaza, dans le cadre d'un plan proposé par le président américain Donald Trump. Mais de nombreuses zones d'ombres persistent dans ce plan. Analyse de David Delos, chroniqueur international à France 24.

title: Violentes frappes sur la ville de Gaza, Trump appelle Israël à mettre fin aux bombardements
summary: L'armée israélienne a déclaré samedi 4 octobre poursuivre son offensive dans la ville de Gaza et a averti les habitants de ne pas retourner dans la zone, malgré un appel du président américain Donald Trump à mettre fin immédiatement aux bombardements d'Israël. Le point avec Claire Duhamel, correspondante de France 24 à Jérusalem.

title: Syrie : Deir Ezzor, fracture au cœur du pays
summary: Le processus d'intégration dans l'armée syrienne post-Assad de miliciens — notamment Kurdes — s'avère difficile, malgré un accord politique remontant au mois de mars. Les choses traînent en longueur. Les négociations sont difficiles et stagnent et des incidents sécuritaires compliquent le processus. Dans la province de Deir Ezzor, les forces armées du Nord-est (FDS), à dominante Kurdes, et l'armée syrienne se font face. Reportage de Marie-Charlotte Roupie, envoyée spéciale de France 24.

title: Guerre à Gaza : le Hamas prêt à libérer les otages
summary: Vendredi 3 octobre, le mouvement islamiste palestinien Hamas s'est dit prêt à des négociations immédiates en vue de la libération des otages et de la fin de la guerre, dans le cadre d'un plan proposé le 29 septembre par le président américain.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu promet de désarmer le Hamas et de libérer les otages "dans les prochains jours"
summary: Le premier ministre israélien Benjamin Netanyahu a promis samedi de désarmer le Hamas et a déclaré avoir demandé à des négociateurs de se rendre en Égypte pour mener des discussions sur la libération des otages. La Défense civile de Gaza a fait état d'au moins 57 morts dans des frappes d'Israël depuis l'aube, malgré l'appel de Donald Trump à cesser immédiatement son offensive sur le territoire palestinien. Le fil du 4 octobre 2025.

title: Gaza : le Hamas prêt à libérer les otages, Donald Trump demande l'arrêt immédiat des bombardements
summary: Après la réponse favorable du Hamas à son plan de paix pour Gaza, Donald Trump a estimé vendredi que le mouvement islamiste palestinien "était prêt pour une paix durable" et a demandé à Israël d'arrêter "immédiatement les bombardements" afin que les otages puissent être libérés "en toute sécurité". De son côté, Israël affirme "se préparer" pour ces libérations.

title: Plan Trump pour Gaza : le Hamas prêt à libérer tous les otages et à négocier les détails de l'accord
summary: Le Hamas a annoncé vendredi avoir accepté de libérer tous les otages israéliens, vivants ou morts, selon les termes de la proposition du président américain Donald Trump pour Gaza, et s'est dit prêt à entamer immédiatement des négociations par le biais de la médiation pour discuter des détails de l'accord.

title: Tony Blair et le déni de la Palestine
summary: Les liens étroits de l’ancien premier ministre britannique avec Benyamin Nétanyahou en font un acteur central du plan de Donald Trump pour Gaza, écrit l’historien Jean-Pierre Filiu dans sa chronique.

title: En Indonésie, le bilan de l’effondrement d’une école passe à 37 morts
summary: Les recherches se poursuivent dans une partie de l’internat de l’école islamique située à Sidoarjo, où 26 personnes sont toujours portées disparues.

title: Au Royaume-Uni, les « Pink Ladies » défilent contre la migration « de masse »
summary: Apparues à l’été 2025 lors de manifestations contre les demandeurs d’asile, elles se présentent comme un mouvement de protection des femmes et des enfants. Leur mobilisation, relayée par l’extrême droite, est un symptôme de la radicalisation d’une partie de l’opinion sur la question migratoire.

title: La garde nationale envoyée à Chicago par la Maison Blanche, mais bloquée à Portland par une décision de justice
summary: Donald Trump a signé, samedi, un décret pour dépêcher 300 réservistes de l’armée dans la ville de l’Illinois, au moment où une juge fédérale a bloqué celui ordonné à Portland, en Oregon.

title: Donald Trump accentue la pression sur le Hamas pour qu’il accepte son plan de paix à Gaza
summary: Le président américain exige du mouvement palestinien une réponse rapide concernant une ligne de retrait de l’armée israélienne, acceptée par l’Etat hébreu. Israël continue de bombarder l’enclave malgré l’appel au cessez-le-feu de la Maison Blanche.

title: Badr Abdelatty, chef de la diplomatie égyptienne : « Nous comptons sur Donald Trump pour faire respecter le cessez-le-feu à Gaza »
summary: Dans un entretien accordé au « Monde », samedi 4 octobre, le ministre des affaires étrangères égyptien appelle à ce que cesse le « bain de sang » en mettant en place la première partie du plan Trump. Il propose, dans un second temps, d’éclaircir les éléments qui doivent acter le retrait de l’armée israélienne de l’enclave palestinienne.

title: A Madagascar, Andry Rajoelina perd la bataille de la rue
summary: Le président malgache n’est pas parvenu, samedi, à mobiliser ses partisans, pour manifester leur soutien, après dix jours de soulèvement de la génération Z.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : la société des chemins de fer ukrainiens dénonce une « intensification des attaques » russes contre ses infrastructures
summary: Une double frappe sur la gare de Chostka, samedi, dans la région de Soumy a fait au moins un mort et 30 blessés, selon les autorités ukrainiennes. Le patron de la société Ukrzaliznytsia a dit avoir relevé « 40 attaques majeures » sur le réseau des chemins de fer depuis août en vue de « semer la panique ».

title: La très sélecte escadrille à plumes de l’armée française : « Ici, les pigeons prennent un bain chaque jour. S’ils sont sales ou malades, ils se laissent dépérir »
summary: A Suresnes, près de Paris, la forteresse du mont Valérien abrite le dernier colombier militaire d’Europe. Même si, à l’heure de l’ultra-technologisation des armements, le pigeon voyageur ne se déplace plus que pour les cérémonies officielles, il reste un symbole fort de l’histoire de l’armée.

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : Donald Trump assure qu’Israël a accepté une ligne de retrait dans la bande de Gaza
summary: Le président américain a affirmé que le cessez-le-feu entrera en vigueur et que l’échange des otages et des prisonniers commencera lorsque le Hamas donnera son accord pour cette ligne tracée à l’intérieur de la bande de Gaza, à une distance d’1,5 km à 3,5 km des frontières du territoire palestinien.

title: De nouvelles manifestations propalestiniennes dans plusieurs grandes villes d’Europe
summary: De Rome à Dublin, en passant par Madrid et Paris, la mobilisation reste vive, accentuée par l’interception par les forces israéliennes de la flottille humanitaire qui tentait de se rendre à Gaza.

title: Guerre en Ukraine : au moins un mort et des dizaines de blessés dans l’attaque russe contre une gare ferroviaire. Retrouvez les informations du 28 septembre au 4 octobre.
summary: Le corps sans vie d’un homme de 71 ans a été retrouvé parmi les décombres de l’un des trains visés par une frappe sur la gare de Chostka, dans l’oblast de Soumy, dans le nord de l’Ukraine. Le président ukrainien, Volodymyr Zelensky, a qualifié cette attaque de « barbare ».

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • At least 70 people, including women and children, were killed in the attacks, including 47 people in Gaza City alone, according to the Gaza media office.

  • British police announced arresting 492 protesters in London during a rally in support of Palestinians in Gaza and the Palestine Action, an activist group designated as a “terrorist organisation” in the country in July.

  • Israeli military arrested at least 19 Palestinians from the village of al-Zweidin in Yatta Badia, south of Hebron in the occupied West Bank, following an Israeli settler attack, Wafa news agency reported.

  • US President Donald Trump's Gaza peace plan was a "vital opportunity" to stop bloodshed in the Palestinian territory "once and for all', UN rights chief Valker Turk said.

  • Huge numbers turned out at pro-Palestinian rallies in Europe, calling for an immediate end to Israel's war on Gaza and the release of activists on board a flotilla carrying humanitarian aid to the territory.

  • International activists who arrived in Istanbul after being deported from Israel following the military's interception of their Gaza-bound flotilla said they had been subjected to violence and "treated like animals". 

  • US President Donald Trump's son-in-law Jared Kushner and a senior envoy are heading to Egypt to finalise captive release details, a White House official said after Hamas reacted positively to a peace plan to end Israel's two years of war on Gaza.

title: Gaza death toll rises as Israeli strikes continue, says media office
summary:
Gaza death toll rises as Israeli strikes continue, says media office

The Gaza media office on Saturday slammed Israel for continuing its "brutal aggression against the Palestinian people" despite the US President Donald Trump's call to halt the attacks on Gaza.

The Israeli army is "openly committing massacres" as it carried out more than 93 air and artillery strikes on areas densely populated with displaced civilians since dawn today, the office said.

At least 70 people, including women and children, were killed in the attacks, including 47 people in Gaza City alone, according to the statement.

"It confirms that the occupation is ignoring all international calls for calm and insisting on continuing the systematic killing of civilians and the destruction of life in the Gaza Strip," the office said.

title: Over 490 people arrested in UK during Palestine Action protest
summary:
Over 490 people arrested in UK during Palestine Action protest

British police announced arresting 492 protesters in London during a rally in support of Palestinians in Gaza and the Palestine Action, an activist group designated as a “terrorist organisation” in the country in July.

Prime Minister Keir Starmer urged protesters to stay home this weekend, after a deadly synagogue attack on Thursday. In response, the organisers of the protest reiterated the intention to go ahead with the protest, urging police to dedicate their resources to protecting communities from reprisal attacks in the wake of Thursday's attack on a synagogue in Manchester.

The Metropolitan Police said in a post on X that "488 of the arrests were for supporting a proscribed organisation", adding that the youngest person arrested was 18, the oldest was 89."

According to the latest police update, 297 people remain in custody, while the rest have been bailed.

title: Israeli forces arrest 19 Palestinians after settlers attack village in West Bank
summary:
Israeli forces arrest 19 Palestinians after settlers attack village in West Bank

Israeli military arrested at least 19 Palestinians from the village of al-Zweidin in Yatta Badia, south of Hebron in the occupied West Bank, following an Israeli settler attack, Wafa news agency reported.

Israelis from illegal settlements attacked and injured some Palestinians who were later arrested, village council head Saeed al-Taimat said.

The arrests came after settlers stormed the village and shot a young man in the foot.

title: Trump says Israel agreed to 'withdrawal line,' Hamas confirmation would trigger immediate ceasefire
summary:
Trump says Israel agreed to 'withdrawal line,' Hamas confirmation would trigger immediate ceasefire

US President Donald Trump said in a social media post on Saturday that Israel has agreed to an "initial withdrawal line" for Gaza, which has also been shared with Hamas.

Trump said "when Hamas confirms," a ceasefire will be effective "immediately" and a prisoner exchange will begin, setting the stage for the next phase of Israel's withdrawal from the Palestinian enclave.

title: Netanyahu hopes to bring captives home within days as negotiators head to Cairo
summary:
Netanyahu hopes to bring captives home within days as negotiators head to Cairo

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Saturday that he hoped to bring home the captives being held by Hamas in a matter of days, as negotiators headed to Cairo for talks aimed at putting an end to Israel's war on Gaza.

"I hope that in the coming days we will be able to bring back all our hostages," Netanyahu said.

The premier added he had ordered negotiators to Egypt "to finalise the technical details", with Cairo confirming it would also be hosting a delegation from Hamas for talks on "the ground conditions and details of the exchange of all Israeli detainees and Palestinian prisoners" as per Trump's proposal.

title: Gaza civil defence says at least 57 killed in Israeli strikes since dawn
summary:
Gaza civil defence says at least 57 killed in Israeli strikes since dawn

Gaza’s civil defence agency said Israeli bombardment had killed at least 57 people since dawn on Saturday, even after US President Donald Trump urged Israel to halt its attacks on the territory.

"The death toll from the ongoing Israeli bombardment since dawn today stands at 57, including 40 in Gaza City alone," Mahmud Bassal, the agency's spokesman, told AFP.

Bassal said the victims in Gaza City included 18 people who were killed in an Israeli strike targeting the home of the Abdul Aal family in the city's Al-Tuffa neighbourhood.

title: UN rights chief hails chance to stop Gaza carnage 'once and for all'
summary:
UN rights chief hails chance to stop Gaza carnage 'once and for all'

US President Donald Trump's Gaza peace plan was a "vital opportunity" to stop bloodshed in the Palestinian territory "once and for all', UN rights chief Valker Turk said Saturday.

Trump has called on key US ally Israel to stop the fighting in the Gaza Strip, while Hamas says it is ready to release all captives and start talks to end the nearly two-year war.

Turk hopes the momentum from the US president's peace plan will "pave the way for a permanent cessation of hostilities, followed by recovery and reconstruction his office said on X as it urged a resolution "in line with international human rights and humanitarian laws, and the much needed two state solution."

The World Health Organisation also welcomed the plan, particularly the prospect of reconstructing hospitals.

"In two years, we have never been closer to securing peace than now. We cannot miss this opportunity. Too many lives been lost and shattered," the UN health agency's chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said in a statement.

title: Hundreds of thousands turn out at pro-Palestinian marches in Europe
summary:
Hundreds of thousands turn out at pro-Palestinian marches in Europe

Huge numbers turned out at pro-Palestinian rallies in Europe on Saturday, calling for an immediate end to Israel's war on Gaza and the release of activists on board a flotilla carrying humanitarian aid to the territory.

Organisers of the protest in Rome said hundreds of thousands of people had turned out for a fourth day running, after Israel intercepted the 45-strong flotilla seeking to reach Gaza earlier this week.

Some 70,000 people, according to police, took to the streets in Barcelona, in one of several pro-Palestinian protests to take place across Spain.

Elsewhere, several thousand people marched through the centre of the Irish capital, Dublin, to mark what organisers said was "two years of genocide" in Gaza.

title: British police arrest 175 people at pro-Palestine protest
summary:
British police arrest 175 people at pro-Palestine protest

British police have said in a post on X that it arrested 175 people during a Palestine Action protest in London.

The pro-Palestine action group was proscribed as “a terrorist organisation” in the UK in July.

The Metropolitan Police said the arrests include six people who had unfurled a banner on Westminster Bridge that read: “I oppose genocide. I support Palestine Action.”

title: 'We were treated like animals', deported Gaza flotilla activists say
summary:
'We were treated like animals', deported Gaza flotilla activists say

International activists who arrived in Istanbul after being deported from Israel following the military's interception of their Gaza-bound flotilla said Saturday they had been subjected to violence and "treated like animals". 

The Global Sumud Flotilla set sail last month seeking to ferry aid to war-battered Gaza but Israel blocked the boats, detaining more than 400 people whom it began deporting on Friday.

Of that number, 137 activists from 13 countries flew into Istanbul on Saturday, among them 36 Turkish nationals.  

"They put us on our knees, facing down. And if we moved, they hit us. They were laughing at us, insulting us and hitting us," Paolo Romano, a regional councillor from Lombardy in Italy said. 

 “They dragged little Greta (Thunberg) by her hair before our eyes, beat her, and forced her to kiss the Israeli flag. They did everything imaginable to her, as a warning to others,” Anadolu Agency reported Turkish activist and Sumud Flotilla participant Ersin Celik saying.

title: Gaza death toll rises
summary:
Gaza death toll rises

At least 41 people have been killed since dawn due to Israeli shelling and fire, Al Jazeera Arabic reported, citing medical sources.

Among the dead, 35 were killed in Gaza City, the sources said.

The attacks on Gaza continue despite US President Donald Trump having called for Israel to halt the bombings.

title: 22nd Traditional Ritual Theater Festival opens in Tehran
summary: The 22nd Traditional and Ritual Theater Festival was inaugurated on Saturday evening, October 4, 2025, at the Tehran Union House, with the presence of officials, artists, and guests from Turkey and Armenia, featuring a variety of performances, including shadow puppetry, storytelling, tent theater, and music.

title: Modern adaptation of Antigone staged in Ahvaz
summary: The play Antigone, written and directed by Neda Azizieh, has been on stage at the Artists’ House of Ahvaz since September 16, 2025. The modern adaptation of Sophocles’s classic tragedy explores themes that resonate with contemporary human struggles.

title: Iran condemns attack on Sumud flotilla and arrest of pro-Palestinian activists
summary: The Foreign Ministry spokesperson strongly condemned the Israeli regime's attack on the Sumud humanitarian flotilla in international waters and the violent arrest of the activists supporting the Palestinian people as terrorist act aimed at perpetuating the famine imposed on Gaza.

title: World must end impunity for war criminals: Iran
summary: The Foreign Ministry spokesperson stressed that the world must stop brutal violations of the law, end impunity for war criminals and genocide, and hold accountable those who justify these crimes.

title: Israel kills over 60 Palestinians in Gaza in one day
summary: The brutal Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip have left 61 martyrs in the past 24 hours, despite international pressure and the appeal of Donald Trump, the regime's main supporter and ally.

title: British police arrests 175 in London anti-Israel protests
summary: British police arrested 175 people under strict security measures during massive pro-Palestinian protests in London.

title: Trump's Gaza plan aims to exonerate Israel from its crimes: Hezbollah chief
summary: Sheikh Naim Qassem stressed that Trump’s plan is completely consistent with Israel's interests and to realize the 'Greater Israel' project through politics after failing to achieve it through aggression and crimes.

title: Pezeshkian says Western allegations about Iran’s peaceful nuclear activities are baseless
summary: President Pezeshkian strongly defended Iran’s peaceful nuclear program, attributing regional instability to Israeli aggression supported by the US, and cited Western bad faith and the collapse of the JCPOA as reasons for Iran’s advanced nuclear activities.

title: Vice President Aref says scientific advances key to confronting adversaries
summary: Mohammad Reza Aref stressed that Iran’s long-term advantage lay not in underground resources but in its educated youth.

title: Pro-Palestinian protesters rally in London despite police warnings
summary: Police said six people were arrested on suspicion of supporting what it described as a “proscribed organization.”

title: Chabahar satellite base ready for inaugural launch; two others to be operational: ICT minister
summary: Hashemi said that the homegrown space industry, including satellites and launch site would bring a bright future for the Islamic Republic.

title: Kazakhstan seeks enhanced economic cooperation with Iran: Ambassador
summary: Ontalap Onalbayev emphasized expanding economic cooperation in agriculture, industry, and tourism between Iran and Kazakhstan.

title: Bitcoin sets another all-time high, rising beyond $124,480
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – Bitcoin rose to a new record as the token climbed to as high as $124,480 on Sunday, data from the Binance platform showed.

title: North Korea's Kim Jong-un unveils next-generation weapons
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – North Korea’s leader Kim Jong-un has attended the opening of the Military Hardware exhibition Defiance Development-2025 in Pyongyang.

title: Iran condemns Israel’s attack on Sumud Flotilla
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesman condemned the Israeli regime's assault on the Sumud Flotilla in international waters and called the violent detention of pro-Palestinian activists an act of terrorism.

title: Araghchi holds key meeting with foreign diplomats in Tehran
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Minister Seyed Abbas Araghchi met with ambassadors, chargés d’affaires, and heads of foreign and international missions in Tehran to brief them on the country’s latest positions.

title: Syria holds elections under tightened security
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – Syria is holding parliamentary elections on Sunday for the first time since the fall of Bashar Assad, who was unseated in a rebel offensive in December.

title: Gaza’s future looks bright: Khaled Qaddoumi
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – The Hamas representative in Tehran emphasized that the peace talks should have meaningful impacts on the people of Gaza, stressing that Israeli forces should evacuate the area and Gaza must be rebuilt.

title: VIDEO: Matmo typhoon to affect China coastal areas
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – Due to the impact of this year's 21st typhoon, Matmo, the coastal areas of south China are expected to experience strong winds and heavy rainfall.

title: Another regional war could erupt to hold Israel accountable
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – Javed Rana warns that, in the long run, Israel could be held accountable potentially through another war and this time, Arab states that have supported Israel might also be drawn into the conflict.

title: Intl. Ritual and Traditional Theater Festival in Tehran
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – The opening ceremony of 22nd International Ritual and Traditional Theater Festival was held in House of Etehadieh in Tehran on Saturday.

title: Israel raids southern Syria again
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – Local Syrian news sources reported yet another Israeli incursion in the south of the Arab country.

title: Trump announces Israel agreed to ‘initial withdrawal line"
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – US President Donald Trump on Saturday announced Israel has agreed to the "initial withdrawal line" in Gaza, which the US has shared with Hamas.

title: Turkish FM warns Netanyahu may disrupt Gaza ceasefire efforts
summary: TEHRAN, Oct. 05 (MNA) – Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan warned that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu could at any moment derail the ongoing efforts to end the Gaza war.

title: عراقچی: دیپلماسی هیچوقت به پایان نمی رسد
summary: وزیر امور خارجه کشورمان گفت: دیپلماسی هیچوقت به پایان نمی رسد اما اینکه چگونه و با چه شرایطی به پایان می رسد، قابل بحث است.

title: نصب ۸ هزار کنتور هوشمند برای مشترکان تجاری لرستان
summary: خرم‌آباد - مدیرعامل شرکت توزیع برق لرستان از نصب هشت هزار و ۳۴۵ کنتور هوشمند برای مشترکات تجاری این استان خبر داد.

title: دستگیری سارق حرفه ای در دامغان؛ ۱۶ فقره سرقت در پرونده متهم است
summary: دامغان- جانشین فرمانده انتظامی استان سمنان از دستگیری سارق حرفه ای توسط کلانتری ۱۷ دیباج خبر داد و گفت: این متهم به انجام ۱۶ فقره انواع سرقت اقرار داشته است.

title: حسین پور: افتتاح نخستین مرکز علوم و فناوری نوین کودک و نوجوان در مشهد
summary: مشهد- مدیرکل کانون پرورش فکری خراسان رضوی گفت: نخستین مرکز علوم و فناوری نوین کودک و نوجوان کشور با عنوان «کاف‌نا» در هفته ملی کودک در مشهد افتتاح می‌شود.

title: رئیس دانشگاه آزاد فردا مشخص می شود
summary: رئیس نهاد رهبری در دانشگاهها از معرفی و تعیین تکلیف ریاست دانشگاه آزاد تا فردا خبر داد.

title: المیادین: کاهش سطح حملات صهیونیست‌ها به غزه دروغ محض است
summary: شبکه خبری المیادین اعلام کرد که شایعات صهیونیست‌ها مبنی بر کاهش سطح حملات به غزه و منحصر کردن آن به عملیات دفاعی دروغ محض است و حملات با همان شدت قبل ادامه دارد.
